attributes.name: DS.Model
attributes.description:
The model class that all Ember Data records descend from.
  This is the public API of Ember Data models. If you are using Ember Data
  in your application, this is the class you should use.

methods.description:
Create a JSON representation of the record, using the serialization
strategy of the store's adapter.

   `serialize` takes an optional hash as a parameter, currently
supported options are:

   - `includeId`: `true` if the record's ID should be included in the
  JSON representation.
methods.name: serialize

return.description: an object whose values are primitive JSON values only

methods.description:
Use [DS.JSONSerializer](DS.JSONSerializer.html) to
get the JSON representation of a record.

`toJSON` takes an optional hash as a parameter, currently
supported options are:

- `includeId`: `true` if the record's ID should be included in the
  JSON representation.
methods.name: toJSON

return.description: A JSON representation of the object.

methods.name: deleteRecord
destroyRecord

return.description:
a promise that will be resolved when the adapter returns
successfully or rejected if the adapter returns with an error.

methods.description: Unloads the record from the store. This will cause the record to be destroyed and freed up for garbage collection.
methods.name: unloadRecord
changedAttributes

return.description:
an object, whose keys are changed properties,
  and value is an [oldProp, newProp] array.

methods.description:
If the model `hasDirtyAttributes` this function will discard any unsaved
changes. If the model `isNew` it will be removed from the store.

Example

```javascript
record.get('name'); // 'Untitled Document'
record.set('name', 'Doc 1');
record.get('name'); // 'Doc 1'
record.rollbackAttributes();
record.get('name'); // 'Untitled Document'
```
methods.name: rollbackAttributes
save

return.description:
a promise that will be resolved when the adapter returns
successfully or rejected if the adapter returns with an error.

methods.name: reload

params.name: options
params.description: optional, may include `adapterOptions` hash which will be passed to adapter request

return.description:
a promise that will be resolved with the record when the
adapter returns successfully or rejected if the adapter returns
with an error.

methods.description:
Override the default event firing from Ember.Evented to
also call methods with the given name.
methods.name: trigger
belongsTo
hasMany

methods.description:
Provides info about the model for debugging purposes
by grouping the properties into more semantic groups.

Meant to be used by debugging tools such as the Chrome Ember Extension.

- Groups all attributes in "Attributes" group.
- Groups all belongsTo relationships in "Belongs To" group.
- Groups all hasMany relationships in "Has Many" group.
- Groups all flags in "Flags" group.
- Flags relationship CPs as expensive properties.
methods.name: _debugInfo
eachRelationship

params.name: binding
params.description: the value to which the callback's `this` should be bound

methods.description:
Create should only ever be called by the store. To create an instance of a
`DS.Model` in a dirty state use `store.createRecord`.

   To create instances of `DS.Model` in a clean state, use `store.push`
methods.name: create
typeForRelationship

return.description: the type of the relationship, or undefined

methods.name: inverseFor

methods.description:
Given a callback, iterates over each of the relationships in the model,
invoking the callback with the name of each relationship and its relationship
descriptor.
methods.name: eachRelationship

params.name: binding
params.description: the value to which the callback's `this` should be bound

methods.description:
Given a callback, iterates over each of the types related to a model,
invoking the callback with the related type's class. Each type will be
returned just once, regardless of how many different relationships it has
with a model.
methods.name: eachRelatedType

params.name: binding
params.description: the value to which the callback's `this` should be bound

methods.name: eachAttribute

params.name: binding
params.description: the value to which the callback's `this` should be bound

methods.name: eachTransformedAttribute

params.name: binding
params.description: the value to which the callback's `this` should be bound

methods.description: Returns the name of the model class.
methods.name: toString

events.description:
Fired when the record is ready to be interacted with,
that is either loaded from the server or created locally.
events.name: ready

events.description: Fired when the record is loaded from the server.
events.name: didLoad

events.description: Fired when the record is updated.
events.name: didUpdate

events.description: Fired when a new record is commited to the server.
events.name: didCreate

events.description: Fired when the record is deleted.
events.name: didDelete

events.description: Fired when the record becomes invalid.
events.name: becameInvalid

events.description: Fired when the record enters the error state.
events.name: becameError

events.description: Fired when the record is rolled back.
events.name: rolledBack

properties.description:
If this property is `true` the record is in the `empty`
state. Empty is the first state all records enter after they have
been created. Most records created by the store will quickly
transition to the `loading` state if data needs to be fetched from
the server or the `created` state if the record is created on the
client. A record can also enter the empty state if the adapter is
unable to locate the record.
properties.name: isEmpty

properties.description:
If this property is `true` the record is in the `loading` state. A
record enters this state when the store asks the adapter for its
data. It remains in this state until the adapter provides the
requested data.
properties.name: isLoading
isLoaded
hasDirtyAttributes
isSaving
isDeleted
isNew

properties.description:
If this property is `true` the record is in the `valid` state.

A record will be in the `valid` state when the adapter did not report any
server-side validation failures.
properties.name: isValid

properties.description:
If the record is in the dirty state this property will report what
kind of change has caused it to move into the dirty
state. Possible values are:

- `created` The record has been created by the client and not yet saved to the adapter.
- `updated` The record has been updated by the client and not yet saved to the adapter.
- `deleted` The record has been deleted by the client and not yet saved to the adapter.

Example

```javascript
let record = store.createRecord('model');
record.get('dirtyType'); // 'created'
```
properties.name: dirtyType
isError

properties.description:
If `true` the store is attempting to reload the record from the adapter.

Example

```javascript
record.get('isReloading'); // false
record.reload();
record.get('isReloading'); // true
```
properties.name: isReloading
id
errors

properties.description:
This property holds the `DS.AdapterError` object with which
last adapter operation was rejected.
properties.name: adapterError
